greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(x^3) * phi(-x^12) / chi(-x^4) in powers of x where phi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (phi(-x^24)^2 + 2 * x^3 * psi(-x^12)^2) / chi(-x^4) in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
Expansion of q^(-1/6) * eta(q^6)^5 * eta(q^8) / (eta(q^4) * eta(q^3)^2 * eta(q^24)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (144 t)) = 8^(1/2) (t/i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A257400.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ -x^4, x^4] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, x^3] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, x^12], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^6 + A)^5 * eta(x^8 + A) / (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^3 + A)^2 * eta(x^24 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 21 2015
